pages.text: $(item)Heat Exchangers$() do not dissipate Heat, but move it.$(br2)Heat Exchangers will try to move Heat so everything it interacts with is the same percentage cooled.$(br2)If the Reactor has 6250 heat, the Exchanger will absorb 1250 heat, leaving 5000 heat in the Reactor. This results in both being at 50% heat capacity.
The $(item)Advanced Heat Exchanger$() works the same, but has a higher Coolant and moves heat faster.

The $(item)Reactor Heat Exchanger$() excels at exchanging Heat with the Reactor, but cannot exchange Heat with other Components on its own.$(br2)Other Components can pull its Heat, or Cool it directly.

The $(item)Component Heat Exchanger$() excels at exchanging Heat with adjacent Components, but cannot exchange Heat with the Reactor.$(br2)These work well as a sort of "Heat wire", providing more access for Vents etc.
